intro: Adelia virgata, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its silver-green foliage and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is often found in rocky or sandy habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Adelia virgata is valued for its ornamental appeal and is used in gardens for its drought tolerance and low maintenance requirements.
